cmput301w14t13.project.services
Class NetworkReceiver

java.lang.Object
  BroadcastReceiver
      cmput301w14t13.project.services.NetworkReceiver

public class NetworkReceiver
extends BroadcastReceiver

This class is constantly listening for changes in the network signal once a change is detected the onReceive method changes the isConnected field to true if we are connected and false if not. It is Used to determine if an action the user takes needs to be done locally or through the server. For Example, when creating, editing, Topics or comments, or editing or getting location we need to know if we have a connection.

Author:
nsd

Method Summary
static void initialState(Context context)
           
 void onReceive(Context context, Intent intent)
          Upon receiving a network change, we check if we are online or offline if online, we tell user they are on online mode and we refresh the CommentTree with the latest Topics and Comments of offline, we tell the user they are on offline mode and refresh the CommentTree to show the latest grabbed Topics or Comments on the CommentTree

onReceive

public void onReceive(Context context,
                      Intent intent)
Upon receiving a network change, we check if we are online or offline if online, we tell user they are on online mode and we refresh the CommentTree with the latest Topics and Comments of offline, we tell the user they are on offline mode and refresh the CommentTree to show the latest grabbed Topics or Comments on the CommentTree
